intro: Sanicula canadensis var. floridana, commonly known as the Florida cowbane, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
